ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: Central Illinois Public Service Company - Tariffs of General Applicability

record_data.record_narrative_name: AIC Volume 10, Services Tariff, Section 3, Regulatory Filings
record_data.record_plain_text: Ameren Illinois Company Volume No. 10 Services Tariff 3. Regulatory Filings Nothing contained in the Tariff shall be construed as affecting in any way the right of the Transmission Owner(s) to unilaterally make application to the Commission for a change in the rates, terms and conditions set forth in this Services Tariff under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act and pursuant to the Commission's rules and regulations promulgated thereunder. Nothing contained in the Tariff or any Service Agreement shall be construed as affecting in any way the ability of any Eligible Customer receiving service under the Tariff to exercise its rights under the Federal Power Act and pursuant to the Commissions rules and regulations promulgated thereunder.

record_data.record_narrative_name: AIC Volume 10, Services Tariff, Section 2, Wholesale Distribution Service
record_data.record_plain_text: Ameren Illinois Company Volume No. 10 Services Tariff 2. Wholesale Distribution Service A Transmission Customer currently paying for Wholesale Distribution Service through an existing Service Agreement or Wholesale Distribution Service Agreement will continue paying the existing rate for Wholesale Distribution Service until such time as its Service Agreement and/or Wholesale Distribution Service Agreement either terminates or is amended consistent with its terms.

record_data.record_narrative_name: AIC Volume 10, Services Tariff, Section 1, Definitions
record_data.record_plain_text: Ameren Illinois Company Services Tariff Volume No. 10 1. Definitions Control Area Operator: Ameren Services Company on behalf of Ameren Illinois Company. Designated Agent: Any entity that performs actions or functions required under the Tariff on behalf of the Transmission Provider, an Eligible Customer, the Transmission Customer or the Control Area Operator. Eligible Customer: (i) Any electric utility (including the Transmission Owner and any power marketer), Federal power marketing agency, or any person generating electric energy for sale for resale is an Eligible Customer under the Tariff. Electric energy sold or produced by such entity may be electric energy produced in the United States, Canada or Mexico. However, with respect to transmission service that the Commission is prohibited from ordering by Section 212(h) of the Federal Power Act, such entity is eligible only if the service is provided pursuant to a state requirement that the Transmission Owner offer the unbundled transmission service, or pursuant to a voluntary offer of such service by the Transmission Owner. (ii) Any retail customer taking unbundled transmission service pursuant to a state requirement that the Transmission Owner offer the transmission service, or pursuant to a voluntary offer of such service by the Transmission Owner, is an Eligible Customer under the Tariff. Service Agreement: The initial agreement and any amendments or supplements thereto entered into by the Transmission Customer and the Transmission Provider for service under the Tariff. Tariff: The open access transmission tariff of the Transmission Provider. Transmission Customer: Any Eligible Customer (or its Designated Agent) that (i) executes a Service Agreement, or (ii) requests in writing that the Transmission Provider file with the Commission, a proposed unexecuted Service Agreement to receive Transmission Service under Module B of the Tariff. This term is used in the Module A Common Tariff Provisions to include customers receiving Transmission Service under Module B of the Tariff. Transmission Owner: Ameren Illinois Company. Transmission Provider: The Midwest Independent Transmission System Operator, Inc. (MISO), or its successor organization. Transmission Service: Point-To-Point Transmission Service provided under Module B of the Tariff on a firm and non-firm basis and Network Integration Transmission Service under Module B of the Tariff. Wholesale Distribution Service: The transmission of electric energy in interstate commerce over Transmission Owners Distribution Facilities pursuant to a Commission accepted Open Access Transmission Tariff.

record_data.record_narrative_name: AIC Services Tariff, Volume 10, Title Page and Table of Contents
record_data.record_plain_text: Ameren Illinois Company Volume No. 10 Services Tariff AMEREN ILLINOIS COMPANY FERC ELECTRIC TARIFF VOLUME NO. 10 SERVICES TARIFF TABLE OF CONTENTS 1. Definitions 1.1. Control Area Operator 1.2. Designated Agent 1.3. Eligible Customer 1.4. Service Agreement 1.5. Tariff 1.6. Transmission Customer 1.7. Transmission Owner 1.8. Transmission Provider 1.9. Transmission Service 1.10. Wholesale Distribution Service 2. Wholesale Distribution Service 3. Regulatory Filings

record_data.record_title: CIPS Market Based Rate Tariff - Vol 1
record_data.record_narrative_name: Ameren Illinois Company Volume 1, Market Based Rate Tariff
record_data.record_plain_text:
AMEREN ILLINOIS COMPANY
POWER SALES TARIFF FOR THE SALE OF ENERGY, CAPACITY AND ANCILLARY SERVICES AT MARKET-BASED RATES
1. Availability: Ameren Illinois Company ("Ameren Illinois Company" or "Seller") makes electric energy and capacity available under this Tariff to any purchaser for resale, subject to the conditions set forth in Paragraph 7 below. Ameren Illinois Company shall make available under this Tariff ancillary services as set forth in Paragraph 4, below. 2. Applicability: Subject to the provisions of Paragraphs 4 and 7 below, this Rate Schedule is applicable to all sales of energy, capacity or ancillary services by Ameren Illinois Company not otherwise subject to a particular rate schedule or tariff of Ameren Illinois Company. 3. Rates: Subject to the provisions of Paragraph 7 below, all sales shall be made at rates negotiated and agreed upon between the purchaser and Ameren Illinois Company. 4. Ancillary Services: RTO/ISO Specific PJM: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. ("PJM") and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection. New York: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service, and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute non-synchronous, 30-minute operating reserves, 10-minute spinning reserves, and 10-minute non-spinning reserves) for sale to purchasers in the market administered by the New York Independent System Operator, Inc. New England: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England, Inc. California: Seller offers regulation service, spinning reserve service, and non-spinning reserve service to the California Independent System Operator Corporation ("CAISO") and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to the CAISO. MISO: Seller offers regulation service and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute spinning reserve and 10-minute supplemental reserve) for sale to the Midcontinent Independent System Operator, Inc. (MISO) and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to MISO. Southwest Power Pool: Seller offers regulation service and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute spinning reserve and 10-minute supplemental reserve) for sale to the Southwest Power Pool, Inc. (SPP) and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to SPP. Third Party Provider
Third-party ancillary services: Seller offers Regulation Service, Reactive Supply and Voltage Control Service, Energy and Generator Imbalance Service, Operating Reserve-Spinning, Operating Reserve-Supplemental, and Primary Frequency Response Service. Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; and (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of the public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier. Sales of Operating Reserve-Spinning and Operating Reserve-Supplemental will not include sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers, except where the Commission has granted authorization. Sales of Regulation Service and Reactive Supply and Voltage Control Service will not include sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers, except at rates not to exceed the buying public utility transmission provider's OATT rate for the same service or where the Commission has granted authorization. 5. Other Terms and Conditions: All other terms and conditions shall be established by agreement between the purchaser and Ameren Illinois Company. 6. Seller Category: Ameren Illinois Company is a Category 2 seller, as defined in 18 CFR 35.36(a), with respect to the Central region. Ameren Illinois Company is a Category 1 seller, as defined in 18 CFR 35.36(a), with respect to all other regions. 7. Ameren Illinois Company shall comply with the provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning a seller's market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes Ameren Illinois Company to engage in affiliate sales under this Tariff or otherwise restricts or limits Ameren Illinois Company's market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning Ameren Illinois Company's market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this Tariff. 8. Limitations and Exemptions: Seller has received waiver of: Subparts B and C of Part 35, except for sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15 and 35.16. See Ameren Illinois Co., Docket No. ER10-1194-004, Delegated Letter Order (April 20, 2016). 9. Effective Date: This Tariff shall be effective on and after the date approved by the FERC.
record_data.filing_title: Ameren Illinois Company Triennial Market Power Filing
